descriptionNullable:
_____
# ECN Terrestrial Site Meteorology Data
### Quality Control and Description
By data.world's Admin [[source]](https://data.world/dataworldadmin)
_____

### About this dataset
> This dataset contains meteorology data collected by Automatic Weather Stations (AWS) at all of the UK Environmental Change Network’s terrestrial sites over a 20 year period. It is an important part of understanding the current and future changes in our environment, standing as a snapshot of conditions before global climate change accelerates. Variables measured include albedo (ground and sky), temperature (dry bulb, wet bulb and soil (at 10cm and 30cm)), relative humidity, radiation (net. and solar), rainfall, surface wetness, soil moisture, wind direction and wind speed - making it an invaluable resource for researchers studying climate change on our planet. ECN is a multi-agency programme sponsored by fourteen government departments/agencies across Britain. Their contribution allows for greater insight into the effects of human activity on our environment so that current conditions can be better evaluated in order to create more sustainable futures. With this dataset available to view or download here on Kaggle you can join in with climate change research today!

### More Datasets
> For more datasets, click [here](https://www.kaggle.com/thedevastator/datasets).

### Featured Notebooks
> - 🚨 **Your notebook can be here!** 🚨! 

### How to use the dataset
> This dataset contains meteorological data collected from the UK Environmental Change Network (ECN) terrestrial sites. It includes measurements of albedo (ground and sky), temperature (dry bulb, wet bulb and soil at 10cm & 30cm depths), relative humidity, radiation(net & solar), rainfallt, surface wetness, soil moisture, wind direction and wind speed. This guide provides information on how to make use of this dataset so that you can get the most out of it. 
> 

### Research Ideas
> - Identifying trends of environmental factors over time such as temperature, rainfall, and relative humidity 
> - Correlating environmental factors with human activities such as agriculture or industrialization to gain insights into the impact of these activities on the environment. 
> - Comparing environmental conditions in different locations or across different seasons to gain a better understanding of how variation affects ecosystems

### Acknowledgements
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the original authors.
> [Data Source](https://data.world/dataworldadmin)
> 
>


### License
> 
> 
> See the dataset description for more information.

### Columns

**File: ECN_MA_qtext.csv**
| Column name     | Description                                                                |
|:----------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **MCODE**       | Unique code related to each individual measurement location/site. (String) |
| **LCODE**       | Unique code related to each location. (String)                             |
| **FIELDNAME**   | The specific fieldname associated with particular measurements. (String)   |
| **FROM_DATE**   | The start date of the measurement. (Date)                                  |
| **TO_DATE**     | The end date of the measurement. (Date)                                    |
| **DATETYPE**    | The type of data being measured. (String)                                  |
| **QCODE**       | Quality control code. (Integer)                                            |
| **CONTINUING**  | Indicates whether the measurement is continuous or not. (Boolean)          |
| **SITECODE**    | Unique code related to each site. (String)                                 |
| **DESCRIPTION** | Description of the measurement site. (String)                              |

### Acknowledgements
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the original authors.
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit [data.world's Admin](https://data.world/dataworldadmin).
title: ECN Terrestrial Site Meteorology Data (Weather)
